intro: Seemannia sylvatica, commonly known as the forest seemannia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly serrated edge, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. Seemannia sylvatica prefers moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens.
